```{r}
library(ggplot2)
gapMinder <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/vfmelfi/STT180SS20/master/gapminder.csv",header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
gapMinder1968 <- subset(gapMinder, year == 1968)
fertility <- gapMinder1968$fertility
lifeexp <- gapMinder1968$lifeExp
str(gapMinder1968)


ggplot(gapMinder1968, aes(x=fertility,y=lifeExp,color = continent)) + geom_point()
```
I found that Europe tended to have the least fertility rate, while also having the highest life expectancy. I also noticed that countries in the Americas had no trend, as every country seemed to hold a different fertility x life expectancy.
